Average season performance percentage is calculated by dividing average load reduction by the average event week nomination. Fixed capacity payment rate depends on the range of average season performance percentage that the customer falls within (this number is multiplied by the number of weeks in the season). After the first 4 events of the season, a variable payment of $0.20 kWh is possible to receive.

Reservation incentive calculated by multiplying monthly load reduction obligation by reservation incentive kilowatt rate. Also performance incentivethat can be received if the customer exceeds their load reduction obligation. Both are billing credits.

Billing credit based on how much energy is curtailed along with the max capacity curtailment of 100 kW

The credit rate ($/kW) will be offered by the company. It will be credited to the customer based on the percent of the committed load that is reduced. If the customer reduces less than 90% of the committed load, the credit will be the actual load reduction x the offered load reduction price plus the difference between 90% of the committed load reduction and the actual reduced load x 200% of the offer price. If the customer reduces between 90% and 110% of the committed load reduction, they will be credited based on their actual reduced load x the offer price. If the customer reduces above 110% of their committed load, they will be credited 110% of their committed load x the offered price. Penalty is removal from the rate schedule.
50% off of the excess demand charges during the 1st 12 months in the program. (come back to this)
Annual incentive paytment based on how much electricity demand is curtailed. (not much detail)

program: Interruptible Credit Option (1-hour notice, 40hrs, year round) (New Mexico)
pay_function: Monthly billing credits calculated by monthly credit rate (mcr) x lesser of customer's CIL or the interruptible demand. MCR equations are different for winter and summer:  Summer (June 1 - September 30) Monthly Credit, per kW - month: MCR = [$7.75 x Ca x Nf) +(Av x Ha)] x Slfx 130% Winter (October 1 - May 30) Monthly Credit  per kW - month: MCR = [$7.75 x Ca x Nf) +(Av x Ha)] x Slf x 85%  (each variable is defined and outlined in the link i provided)"

program: Peak Shaving and Emergency Demand Response Rider (summer) (Tennessee)
pay_function: Curtailment energy credit of 90% of AEP East Load Zone hourly Real-Time LMP per curtailment hour. Curtailment demand credit of either the 4 year average PJM RPM Limited Base DR Base Residual Auction Clearing price (calculated with the previous, current, and next 2 delivery years) or 70% of RPM Net CONE for the current delivery year (both in $ per kW-month). Whichever is higher. Also monthly demand and event credits. Penalty for non-compliance is an annual non-compliance charge of avergae non-compliance demand x 110% of the curtailment demand credits x 12.

program: Peak Shaving and Emergency Demand Response Rider (non summer) (Tennessee)
pay_function: Curtailment energy credit of 90% of AEP East Load Zone hourly Real-Time LMP per curtailment hour. Curtailment demand credit of either the 4 year average PJM RPM Limited Base DR Base Residual Auction Clearing price (calculated with the previous, current, and next 2 delivery years) or 70% of RPM Net CONE for the current delivery year (both in $ per kW-month). Whichever is higher. Also monthly demand and event credits. Penalty for non-compliance is an annual non-compliance charge of avergae non-compliance demand x 110% of the curtailment demand credits x 12.
